result.execSummary:
The defendant Samara O Southard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment at discretion of DOC.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Take medications as prescribed. Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samara O Southard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Partial transcript of sentencing hearing held 1/25/17
for DNA sample
Sealed by the Court.

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding victim rights. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Victim makes statement. Bond no longer in effect. Defense requests that Victim Impact Statement be sealed. Court so orders.
from State advising of no objection to request for adjournment
from Defense requesting rescheduling. Per Court, granted.
Sentencing hearing on January 25, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement, moves to amend Count 2 to misdemeanor battery. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of amended Count 2. Counts 1, 3 are dismissed but read in for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that cases are close to settlement, requests hearing just after the new year. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Change of attorney

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that both cases be set for status conference in hopes of working out global resolution. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, previous activity. Defense advises that resolution is close, requests scheduling in front of Branch 2 for plea/sentencing. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 11:00 am. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 5/2/16.
by State

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. Bond continues as is.  Arraignment scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant
No violent contact with SS. Follow all treatment recommendations in case handled prior to this one. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Samara O Southard in court with attorney Eric Steven Maciolek. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
